timeline.message: fix of the opportunity to find an address from external sources using google maps links

rolled back previous changes;
fix address uri without lat & lon in searchRequest (example: geo:0,0?q=Van+Bleiswijkstraat+66,+2582+LG+The+Hague)

timeline.bodyText:
here should be a comment why do we set lat / lon to 0?
I'm not sure if it's correct or not (probably it is)
timeline.author: vshcherb

replies.bodyText: because from the line "geo:0,0?q=Van+Bleiswijkstraat+66,+2582+LG+The+Hague" in any case 66 and 2582 will be taken as latitude and longitude, which is wrong, because this is an address and there are a lot of such addresses. I decided to compare the minimum and maximum values ​​for coordinates in order to minimize the creation of incorrect coordinates.  maybe this is a temporary solution, maybe there are addresses that are in the min/max range, but nevertheless, similar addresses as from the issue are now processed normally, because further in the method there is a check for equality to 0.0 and the creation of a GeoParsedPoint from the searchRequest string
replies.author: Skalii

timeline.message:
fix previous changes;
add new check;
